intro: Cicca anomala, commonly known as the anomalous cicca, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cicca anomala is considered a vulnerable species.
